mdf:MdfDomain.documentation: Product Definition Framework for Arrangement Architecture
mdf:MdfDomain.name: AA_ProductFramework

classes.documentation: While the Property Classes define the fundamental building blocks, a more specific classification is necessary to fully describe a product. For example a loan product may require more than one type of “Interest” (i.e. “normal interest” and “penalty interest”). To satisfy this requirement the Product Builder has a concept of a Property which is a named type of Property Class. Example Properties of the “Interest” class would be “principal interest”, “penalty interest”, “credit interest”, “debit interest”, etc. Each of these Properties would share a common set of characteristics and processing. It is in fact these lower level Properties to which defined conditions (i.e. specific interest rates) are attached in order to create the products that are available for sale. While the Property Classes are defined and released by Temenos, the underlying Properties are created and maintained by users. Any number of Properties can be defined providing an extremely powerful and flexible means of creating new innovative products. For example if a product type was desired that required three separate interest rates with different calculation methods the user would simply create (or reuse) the three Properties of an “Interest” Property Class. Once the necessary Properties have been created, the designer can use them to define a Product Group by specifying the mandatory and optional Properties which comprise it.
classes.name: AA_PROPERTY

properties.documentation: Any alphanumeric character can be used to define the name of the property. Maximum of 15 characters are allowed.
properties.name: PROPERTY_NAME

properties.documentation: Identifies the Property Class that this AA.PROPERTY record belongs to. Validation Rules: Mandatory Input. Input must be a valid AA.PROPERTY.CLASS ID.
properties.name: PROPERTY_CLASS

properties.documentation: Certain properties are released by Temenos for mapping the existing parameter tables from AA product conditions. A value of YES in this field would indicate that it is a property used for such purposes. Validation Rules: This is a system maintained field and cannot be edited
properties.name: SYSTEM_PROPERTY
en
properties.value: Indicates the User who Authorises the record

properties.name: en
properties.value: Date and time when record was audited

properties.documentation: Describes the AA.PROPERTY and is used for enrichment. This field can be expanded to allow the User to enter the Description of the AA.PROPERTY in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new Language as defined in the LANGUAGE table (Ref: GENERAL TABLES), and will indicate to the User the Language in which the Description must be entered.
properties.name: DESCRIPTION

properties.documentation: Provides a more detailed description of the AA.PROPERTY
properties.name: FULL_DESC

properties.documentation: The options are NULL , PRODUCT.ONLY, SUSPEND and SUSPEND.OVERDUES If PRODUCT.ONLY is selected, the details for this Property are defined only at product level and cannot be viewed or edited at arrangement level. For example for properties which use ACCOUNTING class, it is highly unlikely that the user would need to define or modify accounting rules for each arrangement. Hence defining them at the product would suffice. If SUSPEND is selected, it would mean that the property would be allowed to suspend. Only INTEREST and CHARGE properties can be suspend. If SUSPEND.OVERDUE is defined, it would mean that any overdues in the property will also be suspended when property is suspend. To define SUSPEND.OVERDUE, the property should already be set to SUSPEND.
properties.name: PROPERTY_TYPE

properties.documentation: The prefix to be used to create the new AC.BALANCE.TYPE record. AA provides flexibility for the user to create their own properties and the balances that are linked to those properties. To create balances the standard prefix defined for the class of this property is defaulted here. Noinput and system maintained field.
properties.name: BALANCE_PREFIX

classes.documentation: A Product Line is described by the Property Classes which constitute it and those which do not. The “Lending” line and “Account” line will have a number of common classes such as “Interest” and “Charge” and at least one distinguishing class, which in the case of “Lending” could be an “Overdue” or “Credit Limit” class. The Property Classes and Product Lines which are available are defined by Temenos. The financial institution uses these “building blocks” of functionality to construct the individual products which are available for sale to its customers. The PROPERTY.CLASS definitions are released by Temenos and cannot be amended with the exception of the description fields.
classes.name: AA_PROPERTY_CLASS

properties.documentation: These records are released by Temenos and cannot be created. These are the basic building blocks(components) of a product and Arrangement.
properties.name: PROPERTY_CLASS

properties.documentation: This field can be used for grouping of products. The list of groups available can be defined in the EB.LOOKUP file for AA.PC.GROUP. Used for enquiry and display purposes for filtering out the required classes.
properties.name: CLASS_GROUP

properties.documentation: This field denotes whether delivery information is required for the property class. If this field is set to Y then delivery processing is done for the property class
properties.name: DEL_INFO_REQD
en
properties.value: Indicates the User who Authorises the record

properties.name: en
properties.value: Date and time when record was audited

properties.documentation: Describes the AA.PROPERTY.CLASS and is used for enrichment. This field can be expanded to allow the User to enter the Description of the AA.PROPERTY.CLASS in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new Language as defined in the LANGUAGE table (Ref: GENERAL TABLES), and will indicate to the User the Language in which the Description must be entered. Validation Rules Up to 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters.
properties.name: DESCRIPTION

properties.documentation: Provides a detailed description of the AA.PROPERTY.CLASS Validation Rules Up to 50 type A (alphanumeric) characters
properties.name: FULL_DESC

properties.documentation: This multi-valued field controls attributes that a property of this class may or may not have. Valid options for this field are: CCY – The property conditions for the same product will vary by currency (e.g. interest and principal conditions). The product property condition definition (AA.PRD.DES.xxxxx) will contain the currency in the key. If CCY is not defined then the property will NOT be based on currency. DATED – The property conditions can vary by date and the relevant dated property definition should be used when performing processing. The product property condition (AA.PRD.DES.xxxxx) will contain an effective date in the record key. If DATED is not specified the record will not contain a date. MULTIPLE – Allows more than one property of that class to be defined for a single product. If MULTIPLE is not specified only one property of this class can be linked to an aa product. TRACKING – Certain property classes require that a property can or must be defined at the arrangement level. Other types of property (e.g. interest conditions) may be defined at the product level and the arrangements of that product simly 'track' the product definition and do not require any definition at the arrangement level. If TRACKING is not specified then a property of this class cannot be defined as a tracking property in the product definition. NON.TRACKING - Indicates that the properties belonging to this class should only have fixed link behaviour. In other words, these properties may not have CUSTOM.TRACKING or TRACKING link to the arrangement. OPT.CCY - Indicates that the properties may or may not have Currency component in them. But it needs to have a default non currency condition and when a explicit currency condition is not stated, it picks the default condition for processing. Currently only CHARGE property supports OPT.CCY option. TRACKING.ONLY - Indicates that the properties of this class can ONLY have tracking behaviour. Also, the properties of this class should be stated as PRODUCT.ONLY in AA.PROPERTY. Currently, ACTIVITY.PRESENTATION, ACTIVITY.MESSAGING, ACTIVITY.API and ACCOUNTING are TRACKING.ONLY classes.ARRANGEMENT - This option behaves much like TRACKING.ONLY type, except that the property conditions will be allowed to be amended at the arrangement level subject to negotiation rules. So, when a property class is defined with this type, then, any activity done at arrangement for the property of this class will always see the product and default them in the arrangement condition. This option indicates that the property of this class has some special arrangement level processing, hence, the field values at the arrangement level will not be merged with any of the previously amended arrangement values. Currently, only BALANCE.MAINTENANCE is defined with this type.
properties.name: TYPE

properties.documentation: Indicates the Product line for which BALANCE.PREFIX is associated and accounting can be set as required or not in AA.PROPERTY.CLASS.ACTION
properties.name: PRODUCT_LINE

properties.documentation: A property class can hold related financial balances that are updated by the different activities allowed for that class. The system will derive the name of the associated balance based on the property name and a prefix representing the balance lifecyle stage. Field is associated with Product line This field holds the allowed prefixes for use in the balance type and should reflect the possible stages in the lifecycle. Values should be 3 alphanumeric. A value of AGE here denotes that the balance can move through multiple stages based on the OVERDUE property definitions. Possible values are: AVL - The available balance CUR - The current or live value of the property balance ACC - The current accrued balance for the property DUE - The due balance for property AGE - An aged balance where the prefix will be determined by the overdue status For example the a property called LOANINT would have an accrued balance (CURLOANINT) which then becomes due (DUELOANINT) and ages through stages ODA and ODB giving the balances ODALOANINT and ODBLOANINT. Input only allowed by Temenos
properties.name: BALANCE_PREFIX

classes.documentation: The Product Line provides a high level definition of the business components (Property Classes) that may be required to construct a product belonging to that line. For example the LENDING Product Line will enable users to design and service term loan products such as: Loans (personal, small business, etc.) Mortgages Lines of Credit The Product Lines are defined by Temenos and cannot be created by the User. A Product Line is described by the Property Classes which constitute it. The financial institution may then use these “building blocks” of functionality to construct the individual products which are available for sale to its customers.
classes.name: AA_PRODUCT_LINE

properties.documentation: These records are released by Temenos and cannot be created. Currently, the available option is LENDING, INTERNET.SERVICES and PROXY.SERVICES.
properties.name: PRODUCT_LINE_ID

properties.documentation: When multiple Product line licenses are procured, this field indicates which processes run first and which run next. For example, by default the DEPOSITS schedule get processed before the LENDING schedules and ACCOUNTS run last. The field is system maintained and cannot be modified.Validations:Stores a number which indicates the priority of schedule processingSystem maintained and cannot be modified.
properties.name: BATCH_PRIORITY
en
properties.value: Indicates the User who Authorises the record

properties.name: en
properties.value: Date and time when record was audited

properties.documentation: Describes the AA.PRODUCT.LINE and is used for enrichment. This field can be expanded to allow the User to enter the Description of the AA.PRODUCT.LINE in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new Language as defined in the LANGUAGE table (Ref: GENERAL TABLES), and will indicate to the User the Language in which the Description must be entered. Validation Rules Up to 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters
properties.name: DESCRIPTION

properties.documentation: Provides a more detailed description of the AA.PRODUCT.LINE Validation Rules Up to 50 type A (alphanumeric) characters
properties.name: FULL_DESC

properties.documentation: Identifies the Property Classes that may be included when defining an AA.PRODUCT.GROUP. Validation Rules: Mandatory Input. Input must be a valid AA.PROPERTY.CLASS ID. Multi value field associated with MANDATORY field.
properties.name: PROPERTY_CLASS

properties.documentation: Identifies whether inclusion of a Property a Class in the associated multi value field PROPERTY.CLASS is mandatory when creating a new product in AA.PRODUCT.GROUP and subsequently, AA.PRODUCT.DESIGNER.
properties.name: MANDATORY

properties.documentation: The field indicates the characteristic of this line. Some lines may have a financial angle to it(dealing with amounts, currencies etc) like LENDING and some may not share that characteristic(like INTERNET.SERVICES). Currently to state that the products of this line deal with amounts, this field may be stated as CCY. Validation rules: Maximum of 35 Alphanumeric characters. Accepts CCY or NULL Non-mandatory field.
properties.name: LINE_ATTRIBUTE

properties.documentation: The field assumes significance only when BUNDLE product line is procured. If BUNDLE is procured, even within a single line, the Donors would have to get processed before the Recipients are processed so that the results are consistent during every COB. Validations:DONOR, RECIPIENT - One of the 2 options.No Significance if BUNDLE line is not licensed by the bankSystem maintained and cannot be modified
properties.name: SUB_BATCH_PRIORITY

classes.documentation: This definition would group the discrete properties and give a basic shape to the product. The product group provides a structure to the product whilst also defining constraints to any products derived from the group. The actual conditions of the property would be stated at AA.PRODUCT.DESIGNER level. This application may also be utilised to build AA.ACTIVITY records when new properties/Groups are introduced. While authorizing the product group if the field REBUILD.ACTIVITIES is set to YES, system will create instances of the activity class records.
classes.name: AA_PRODUCT_GROUP

properties.documentation: The id of the product group. Validation rules: Any Alphanumeric character. Maximum of 30 characters.
properties.name: PRODUCT_GROUP

properties.documentation: Valid options are INTERNAL and EXTERNAL INTERNAL - This means that the group being defined is the own Bank's product. Hence only products which are specified as INTERNAL are available for sale to customers. EXTERNAL - There may be a necessity for Banks to do comparison between its own product(INTERNAL) and one by its competitor. Those groups may be defined as EXTERNAL. These products may then be used for comparitive analysis to show the superiority of Bank's own product. Products of this type are not available for sale to own customers.
properties.name: GROUP_TYPE

properties.documentation: When defining a product group, it is mandatory that the group fall into one of the Product lines released by Temenos. When properties are stated in this table, it is mandatory that they should belong to one of the classes defined on the Product line. Product line is the highest level in designing a product. Validation rules: Should be a valid AA.PRODUCT.LINE id. Maximum of 20 characters
properties.name: PRODUCT_LINE

properties.documentation: Certain product groups are released by Temenos to perform mapping to existing parameter tables from Product designer conditions. These groups would have YES on these fields. Validation Rules: Valid input must be either YES or null. This is system updated field and cannot be edited
properties.name: SYSTEM_GROUP

properties.documentation: The field is used to rebuild AA.ACTIVITY records from AA.ACTIVITY.CLASS. AA.ACTIVITY is an instance of AA.ACTIVITY.CLASS and records would be created on AA.ACTIVITY for all instances(properties) of class(property class) during authorisation stage. This can also be used to rebuild activities when a new property is introduced into the group. Validation rule: Accepts YES and NULL. Rebuilds only when the field is stated as YES
properties.name: REBUILD_ACTIVITIES
en
properties.value: Indicates the User who Authorises the record

properties.name: en
properties.value: Date and time when record was audited

properties.documentation: Describes the AA.PRODUCT.GROUP and is used for enrichment. This field can be expanded to allow the User to enter the Description of the AA.PRODUCT.GROUP in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new Language as defined in the LANGUAGE table (Ref: GENERAL TABLES), and will indicate to the User the Language in which the Description must be entered
properties.name: DESCRIPTION

properties.documentation: Provides a more detailed description of the GROUP being defined
properties.name: FULL_DESC

properties.documentation: Identifies the Property Classes that may be included when defining a new product in AA.PRODUCT.DESIGNER. Multi value set of fields associated with AA.PROPERTY and MANDATORY. Validation Rules: Input must be a valid AA.PROPERTY.CLASS id. All mandatory classes in the associated product line record should be defined here.
properties.name: PROPERTY_CLASS

properties.documentation: Identifies the Properties that may be included when defining a new product in AA.PRODUCT.DESIGNER. It is possible to have more than one Property belonging to a Property Class and one or all of these can be Mandatory. Multi value set of fields associated with AA.PROPERTY and MANDATORY. This field is also part of a sub value set with MANDATORY. Validation Rules: Input must be a valid AA.PROPERTY id.
properties.name: PROPERTY

properties.documentation: Identifies whether the defined property is mandatory while designing new product in AA.PRODUCT.DESIGNER. When a property is defined as Mandatory and no condition is specified for that in AA.PRODUCT.DESIGNER, those products would not pass the Publishing process. When a class is defined as mandatory in the AA.PRODUCT.LINE, then atleast one property belonging to that class needs to be defined as mandatory here. Multi value set of fields associated with PROPERTY and PROPERTY.CLASS. This field is also part of a sub value set with PROPERTY. Valid options are NO and YES. Default value is NO.
properties.name: MANDATORY

properties.documentation: This field can be used for classifying the groups. The list of classification can be defined in the EB.LOOKUP file for AA.PRODUCT.GROUP.ATTRIBUTE. For example, a product group may cater to RETAIL banking, whilst another product may cater for PRIVATE banking. These classifications may be done using this field.Since the classification is 'soft', it is left to the discretion of the financial institution as to how they would want to group their products. Validation rules: Non Mandatory field. Contents should be defined in EB.LOOKUP of AA.PRODUCT.GROUP.ATTRIBUTE.
properties.name: ATTRIBUTE
en
properties.value: Indicates the User who Authorises the record

properties.name: en
properties.value: Date and time when record was audited

classes.documentation: An Activity is a business function which can be triggered by a user, the close of business or by another application like Funds Transfer or Teller. An Activity is property specific named instances of AA.ACTIVITY.CLASS Arrangement property conditions are created and maintained by performing a number of activities on the arrangement during its lifetime, Activities can be performed on user request or automatically according to a schedule. The Activities may be created automatically by the system(while authorising AA.PRODUCT.GROUP) or they may be user defined. The user defined activities must be linked to a system activity. The definition of user activities allows the user to setup different charges for the same system activity or different restriction rules.
classes.name: AA_ACTIVITY

properties.documentation: The ID of activity is alpha numeric. System activities always follows the below format <<AA.PRODUCT.LINE>> :<<Activity Name>>: <<AA.PROPERTY or "ARRANGEMENT">> But users can create a derivative of their own and the ID is a free text in those instances. Validation rules: Any Alphanumeric character Maximum of 55 characters
properties.name: ACTIVITY_ID

properties.documentation: All user defined activities must be linked to a core system activity. This field defines system activity to which the given user defined activity is linked. This field cannot be input for system activities. Validation rules: Mandatory for User defined activities Input in this field should be a valid id in AA.ACTIVITY file Maximum of 55 characters Must link to a System activity The value in this field cannot be changed after authorisation of the record.
properties.name: LINKED_ACTIVITY

properties.documentation: This field indicates whether the current activity is a system created or a user defined activity. For system created activity, this would default to YES. System maintained(NOINPUT) field
properties.name: SYSTEM_ACTIVITY

properties.documentation: This field denotes the product line for which this activity is valid. This field gets updated from the ID of the current record. For user activities, this defaults to the product line of the LINKED.ACTIVITY System maintained (NOINPUT) field.
properties.name: PRODUCT_LINE

properties.documentation: This field denotes the process that would be carried out in the activity. This field gets updated from the ID of the current record. For user activities, this defaults to the process id of the LINKED.ACTIVITY System maintained (NOINPUT) field.
properties.name: PROCESS_ID

properties.documentation: The fields denotes the property on which this activity could be triggered. This field gets updated from the ID of the current record. For user activities, this defaults to the property of the LINKED.ACTIVITY System maintained(NOINPUT) field.
properties.name: PROPERTY

properties.documentation: This field is used ONLY whilst simulating an Arrangement scenario and is used only for LENDING, DEPOSIT product lines at the moment.For example, when a NEW arrangement is to be simulated for 2 schedules, the schedules could be run only after the arrangement could be disbursed(either fully or partially). But, disbursement is always transaction driven and may not be captured using a AA.SIMULATION.CAPTURE application. To automatically trigger an activity after the current activity(stated in this ID), this field may be utilised. So, a LENDING-NEW-ARRANGEMENT would have LENDING-DISBURSE-COMMITMENT as its RELATED.ACTIVITY. Similarly, automatic repayments on DUEs may be triggered by using this field. The disbursement and repayments generally assume FULL disbursement and payment which may be altered at the AA.SIMULATION.RUNNER to simulate partial disbursements and payments.Only an activity belonging to the Activity class stated in its AA.ACTIVITY.CLASS may be stated (RELATED.ACT.CLASS field). User Activities may also be stated here as long as they belong to the core Activity class.This field has NO relevance on activities triggered on Live arrangement.Validations:Should be a valid entry in AA.ACTIVITY file.Should belong to the Activity class stated in RELATED.ACT.CLASS field of the AA.ACTIVITY.CLASS.
properties.name: RELATED_ACTIVITY
en
properties.value: Indicates the User who Authorises the record

properties.name: en
properties.value: Date and time when record was audited

properties.documentation: This field describes the AA.ACTIVITY and is used for enrichment. This field can be expanded to allow the User to enter the description of the AA.ACTIVITY in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new Language as defined in the LANGUAGE table (Ref: GENERAL TABLES), and will indicate to the User the Language in which the Description must be entered. Validation Rules Mandatory Field. Up to 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters.
properties.name: DESCRIPTION

properties.documentation: This field provides a detailed description of the AA.ACTIVITY. Validation Rules Mandatory Field. Up to 50 type A (alphanumeric) characters.
properties.name: FULL_DESC

properties.documentation: This field can be used for classifying the activities. The list of classification can be defined in the EB.LOOKUP file for AA.ACTIVITY.ATTRIBUTE. This gets the value from AA.ACTIVITY.CLASS table. Validation rules: Non Mandatory field. Contents should be defined in EB.LOOKUP of AA.ACTIVITY.ATTRIBUTE.
properties.name: ATTRIBUTE

properties.documentation: Overrides, if any, generated by this application is stored here
properties.name: OVERRIDE

classes.documentation: • Each AA.ACTIVITY.CLASS record will define the list of Actions to be applied on the given list of property classes for a given process in the activity • Temenos would release AA.ACTIVITY.CLASS records for product lines and its property classes or the arrangement. Following are examples of some of AA.ACTIVITY.CLASS records, LENDING-NEW-ARRANGEMENT INTERNET.SERVICE-NEW-ARRANGEMENT LENDING-UPDATE-INTEREST INTERNET.SERVICE-UPDATE-PROTECTION.LIMIT • When properties are linked to AA.PRODUCT.GROUP, the system will generate AA.ACTIVITY records which are property specific named instances of AA.ACTIVITY.CLASS. For example when a record in AA.PRODUCT.GROUP for the product line, say LENDING, with following list of properties - LOANINT (Interest Property Class) and REPAYMENT (Payment Schedule Property Class) , is authorised, following AA.ACTIVITY records are created. LENDING-UPDATE-LOANINT LENDING-UPDATE-REPAYMENT • Hence an ACTIVITY definition will be linked to the ACTIVITY.CLASS. When the activity is triggered, the actions to process will be determined by referring to the activity class.
classes.name: AA_ACTIVITY_CLASS

properties.documentation: This field denotes the id of the activity class record. Activities are performed on either the entire Arrangement (Ex. New Arrangement) or on a specific Property (like Change Principal Interest). Since Properties are user-defined, Temenos has specified the composition of each Activity as an Activity Class which targets either a Property Class or the entire Arrangement.
properties.name: ACTIVITY_ID

properties.documentation: This field is used ONLY whilst simulating an Arrangement scenario and is used only for LENDING and DEPOSIT product lines at the moment.For example, when a NEW arrangement is to be simulated for 2 schedules, the schedules could be run only after the arrangement could be disbursed(either fully or partially). But, disbursement is always transaction driven and may not be captured using a AA.SIMULATION.CAPTURE application. To automatically trigger an activity after the current activity(stated in this ID), this field may be utilised. So, a LENDING-NEW-ARRANGEMENT would have LENDING-DISBURSE-TERM.AMOUNT as its RELATED.ACT.CLASS. Similarly, automatic repayments on DUEs may be triggered by using this field. The disbursement and repayments generally assume FULL disbursement and payment which may be altered at the AA.SIMULATION.RUNNER to simulate partial disbursements and payments.Only an activity belonging to this Activity class may be stated in the RELATED.ACTIVITY field of AA.ACTIVITY record. Temenos would release the related activity class that may be used with this activity and cannot be modified by the user.This field has NO relevance on activities triggered on Live arrangement.Validations:Should be a valid entry in AA.ACTIVITY.CLASS file. Validation rules: Should be a valid ID in AA.ACTIVITY.CLASS table.
properties.name: RELATED_ACT_CLASS

properties.documentation: This field denotes the product line for which this activity is valid. This field gets updated from the ID of the current record. System maintained(NOINPUT) field.
properties.name: PRODUCT_LINE

properties.documentation: This field denotes the process that would be carried out in the activity. This field gets updated from the ID of the current record System maintained (NOINPUT) field.
properties.name: PROCESS_ID

properties.documentation: This field represents the property class on which the said action would be performed. System maintained(NOINPUT) field.
properties.name: CLASS_ID
en
properties.value: Indicates the User who Authorises the record

properties.name: en
properties.value: Date and time when record was audited

properties.documentation: This field describes the activity in generic terms and is used for enrichment. This field can be expanded to allow the User to enter the description of the ACTIVITY in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new Language as defined in the LANGUAGE table (Ref: GENERAL TABLES), and will indicate to the User the Language in which the Description must be entered. Validation Rules Mandatory Field. Multi-language field Up to 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters.
properties.name: DESCRIPTION

properties.documentation: This field provides a detailed description of the Activity. Mutiple lines may be stated about the activity. Validation Rules Mandatory Field. NOTES field allowing user to specify multiple lines Up to 50 type A (alphanumeric) characters.
properties.name: FULL_DESC

properties.documentation: This field can be used for classifying the activities. The list of classification can be defined in the EB.LOOKUP file for AA.ACTIVITY.ATTRIBUTE. AA.ACTIVITY records created out of these carry these attributes as well. Validation rules: Non Mandatory field. Contents should be defined in EB.LOOKUP of AA.ACTIVITY.ATTRIBUTE.
properties.name: ATTRIBUTE

properties.documentation: This field indicates how the activity would be triggered and indicate the characteristic of this activity. More than one type indicates the activity would share the characteristic of all types specified.They are classified into the following types: ACCOUNTING - The activity deals with accounting entries and may require balances and allocation rules for them to perform this activity correctly. ACCRUAL - The activity deals with accrual of interest. Activity of this type do not generate AA.ARRANGEMENT.ACTIVITY id everytime but still perform their functionality. They have specific AAA id and use the same everytime this activity is run NORR - The activity will not trigger reversal / replay. The activity would not be reversed / replayed by other activities but can be forcibly reversed by the user. NOREPLAY - The activity would not be reversed / replayed by any other Activity. NOREVERSE - The activity cannot be manually reversed by the user. SCHEDULED - The activity can be executed as part of a scheduled COB job.(like MAKEDUE) TRANSACTION - The activity is triggered by external transactions(like DISBURSE) USER - The activity can be triggered manually by the user. SECONDARY - The activity can be triggered as a SECONDARY activity. SOD-PROCESS - The activity, when processed as a Scheduled activity could be run from the SOD process as well. If the option is not stated the activity would be executed only as part of COB. NOLOG - Whenever activities are performed on an arrangement, they are recorded onto a file called AA.ACTIVITY.HISTORY. An option of NOLOG indicates that those activities need not be recorded into Activity History. PRE.NOTICE - This activity can be generate pre notice advice Validation rules: Valid inputs are ACCOUNTING, ACCRUAL, NORR, NOREPLAY, NOREVERSE, SCHEDULED, TRANSACTION, USER, PRE.NOTICE Can be multi-valued and more than one type may be stated. Duplicates not allowed. Maximum of 12 characters
properties.name: ACTIVITY_TYPE

properties.documentation: When ACTIVITY.TYPE contains SCHEDULED, the batch job in which the activity is to be run should be stated in this field. This field along with BATCH.SEQ determines when this activity(if scheduled) would be run during COB. Validation rules: Mandatory when ACTIVITY.TYPE contains SCHEDULED. Should be a valid entry in BATCH.NEW.COMPANY. Maximum of 35 Alphanumeric characters.
properties.name: BATCH_NAME

properties.documentation: The field assumes significance only when ACTIVITY.TYPE contains SCHEDULED. Several activities may be scheduled to be processed for an arrangement on the same date, the sequence the activities are performed in is important and this is defined as part of the ACTIVITY.CLASS definition. Validation rules: Mandatory when BATCH.NAME is specified Valid only when ACTIVITY.TYPE is SCHEDULED. Only Numeric characters allowed Maximum of 3 characters.
properties.name: BATCH_SEQ

properties.documentation: This field holds a Valid EB.EVENT.TYPE reference for which alerts shall be raised from this Activity class, if Alerts property is included in product and as per the subscription rules
properties.name: ALERT_EVENT_TYPE

properties.documentation: This field represents the property class on which activity could be triggered from. System maintained(NOINPUT) field.
properties.name: PROPERTY_CLASS

properties.documentation: This field indicates whether "Input" function is allowed for this action. Some actions may not require "Input" function even though they may be triggered by user. These go through a special function called 'M' (Method call) and do not leave a trace of transaction but still do a process. Validation rules: YES or NO
properties.name: USER_INPUT

properties.documentation: This field denotes the actual processing that would be performed for this activity. For example, the UPDATE action on interest, might not only update the interest property condition record for the arrangement, might also recalculate the Payment schedule. Hence the UPDATE process of the activity may have multiple actions like: 1. UPDATE on INTEREST class 2. CALCULATE on PAYMENT.SCHEDULE class. Validation rules: Must be a valid ACTION from the corresponding AA.PROPERTY.CLASS record
properties.name: ACTION

properties.documentation: This field denotes the name of the property class in whose designer the current activity would be defined. For example if the USED.PROP.CLASS is defined as ACCOUNTING, then the current activity would be defined in the file AA.PRD.DES.ACCOUNTING. The property class defined should be part of the product line.
properties.name: USED_PROPCLASS

properties.documentation: This field denotes the name of the fields available in the designer property class table defined in USED.PROP.CLASS. For example if the USED.PROP.CLASS is defined as ACCOUNTING and the USED.FIELD as TXN.ACTIVITY, the current activity can be defined in TXN.ACTIVITY field of AA.PRD.DES.ACCOUNTING.
properties.name: USED_FIELD

properties.documentation: This field represents the property class on which activity could be triggered from during Reversal/Deletion ONLY. This field(if stated) would specify the order of executing the property class whilst performing those operations. If this field is not stated, the order of execution would be taken from PROPERTY.CLASS field(Bottom to Top order) System maintained(NOINPUT) field.
properties.name: CAN_PROP_CLASS

properties.documentation: This field indicates whether "REVERSE"/"DELETE" function is allowed for this action. Some actions may not require these even though they may be triggered by user. These go through a special function called 'M' (Method call) and do not leave a trace of transaction but still do a process. Validation rules: YES or NO
properties.name: CAN_USER_INP

properties.documentation: This field denotes the actual processing that would be performed for this activity during Cancellation(Reverse/Delete) Validation rules: Must be a valid ACTION from the corresponding AA.PROPERTY.CLASS record
properties.name: CAN_ACTION
